display() - Method in class mastodontProject.UserSearchArea
Display method to display searched for user, with the option to add them
displayCurrentUserPage() - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays the home page of the currently signed in user with basic information and means of altering the hometown and workplace displayed, all the posts the user has posted with their likes and content and an area for creating and posting a new post
displayFollowed(User) - Method in class mastodontProject.SidebarDisplay
function to display all the friends a user has followed in the side bar
displayFollowedUserPage(User) - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays the page a user passed in as argument
displayGuestAppearance() - Method in class mastodontProject.HeaderDisplay
display the default appearance of the header when a user first opens the program
displayGuestPage() - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays the first screen seen by the user where they choose to either log in or create an account
displayListOfFriends(User) - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
function used to display a list of all the friends of a particular user and allow you to apply variuos filters on that list such as only showing mutual or unique friends or only showing friends on the list who have the same hometown or workplace as the logged in user
displayLoginPage() - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays the log in page for the user
displaySearchFunction() - Method in class mastodontProject.Mastodont
intermediate function from side bar to make the main panel switch to the search area became deprecated when we switched to have the panels be public fields of Mastodont but is still in use in a few places
displaySearchPage() - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays a page to search for users by username and takes you to their account or notifies you if no such user exists
displaySignUpPage() - Method in class mastodontProject.MainDisplay
displays a text field for a new username and a text field for a password and two buttons to either create an account with the corresponding username and password or try to sign in note that a username must be unused to create a new account with it
displayUserAppearance(User) - Method in class mastodontProject.HeaderDisplay
changes the appearance of the header to be more suited to the user who is logged in adds the username of the user in the top right corner and creates a profile image serving as a button to return to the logged in user's profile, though it was really just a proof of concept for displaying images and having it serve a purpose
